reviews.review: Half life is a good style old classic which you can have lots of fun playing. Back when Valve cared about their games.

Played this game because of its reputation and I can understand how excellent it would have been almost 20 years ago. But it was extremely frustrating. Moving and jumping is terrible. It can feel like you are skating when trying to jump to ledges and walk along pipes etc. Shooting while varied is basically just trading bullets, the enemies will always have the upper hand. Many of the puzzles are too long and feel tedious. There were so many instances where I had no idea what to do or how to proceed in the game. I just did not have an enjoyable experience.
И даже после 18 лет, она лучшая. Это игра на все времена.

Half-life is a great game. I have:
Half-life Blue shift
Half-life opposing force
Half-life 2
etc.
And all of them are totally awesome. You'll have fun playing Half-Life, and I promise you, it'll keep you busy for a while.

This game has a huge legacy. I see a lot of people commenting on their nostalgia value. Personally, I never played it as a kid. So this was my first experience with it. The graphics are fine, it is an old game and I understand that. The gameplay is somewhat fun, but gets old fast. The levels are all very similar. My worst complaint is the story, or lack thereof. There is a basic story that the game has. But it is dry, and has almost nothing actually to it. Overall, I played the game just to be sure I didn't miss anything important to the franchise. And I certainly didn't miss anything I wouldn't have gotten by reading the games description.

Sinceramente eu não dava nada pra esse jogo, eu lia as análises e pensava "esse pessoal que jogou na época em que foi lançado gosta no game só por nostalgia e saudosismo", mas zerei o game e retirei tudo que pensava. Para sua época, o jogo e bonito e revolucionário, fazia tempo que não jogava algo com a jogabilidade de half-life, simples e viciante, que até hoje cativa.

Half-Life. Classic Half-Life. Half-Life came out 18 years ago in 1998 when I was 18 years old. I have been playing Half-life for half of my life. Gordon Freeman was 27 years old in the game, half way between my age when the game out and my age now. I have been playing Half-Life over the years, every time I got a new computer, when it was re-released on Ubuntu, then on SteamOS, with the Steam Controller, and again in 4K.

Half-Life has stood the test of time. Unlike other FPSes that were release at the time, it has an engaging story. It makes replaying the game fun. I plan on playing Half-Life again and Black Mesa through what I hope to be the 2nd half of my life.

Spend few $'s and enjoy your past in 100fps =D
9/10

Half-Life (с англ. — «период полураспада») — компьютерная игра в жанре научно-фантастического шутера от первого лица.
Действие игры происходит в гигантском сверхсекретном научно-исследовательском комплексе Чёрная Меза.Действующий персонаж игры — молодой талантливый научный сотрудник, доктор философии  в области теоретической физики, Гордон Фримен, работающий в лаборатории аномальных материалов, которая находится в Чёрной Мезе.
Являясь шутером от первого лица, игра представляет игровой мир глазами главного героя. Игровой процесс не разделён на миссии или этапы, поэтому действие заключается в непрерывном передвижении по целостным локациям, лишь технически разделённым на карты (хотя в середине игры протагониста оглушают солдаты HECU, и он приходит в себя уже в другой локации). Все карты линейны и, как правило, предполагают единственный возможный путь для прохождения. Связанные сюжетом и месторасположением карты объединены в поименованные главы.


                                                                                      Translate

Half-Life (with English   —   "half-life period") — a computer game in a genre of science-fiction shooter from the first person.
Action of a game happens in a huge top secret research complex Black Meuse. The acting character of a game — the young talented research associate, the doctor of philosophy in the field of theoretical physics, Gordon Freeman working in laboratory of abnormal materials which is in Black Meuse.
Being shooter from the first person, a game represents the game world eyes of the main character. Game process isn't divided into missions or stages therefore action consists in continuous movement on the complete locations which are only technically divided into cards (though in the middle of a game of the protagonist soldiers of HECU deafen, and he recovers already in other location). All cards are linear and, as a rule, assume the only possible way for passing. Connected by a plot and a location of the card are united in the named chapters.

I own the original 1998 Half-Life GOTY Edition on CD from when I was a child. My cousin gave it to me. So let me make this easy for you. 

The level of awesome that this game provides, captivated my little child brain to such an extent that I could quite literately (and have, in order to help friends) map out every single level within this game on sheets of graph paper with such vivid detail that you would quite literately question as to whether or not I was a part of the development team at VALVE. 

I put SO many hours into this game. ARMA3 is my #1 most played game on Steam, clocking in at some 500+ hours. ARMA3 aint got shit on Half-Life in terms of time played. 

Buy Half-Life. Buy Half-Life: Blue shift. Buy Half-Life: Counter Strike. Play them all. Then buy Half-Life 2, as well as Episode 1-2. 

And then, like the rest of us, foam at the mouth and develop brain aneurysms due to anxiety and anticipation of the "coming soon" episode 3, or, Half-Life 3, or episode 3; wait, cancel that, coming next year. Well chit, scratch that, its canceled; no, its coming, we just don't know when yet. 

That said. Do not question Valve. EVER. I don't recall if it was HL1 or 2, but one of them was actually scrapped and they started over because they didn't feel it was good enough! And they've nailed every,single,HL. 

BUY THIS GAME (and all the others)<<<<don't forget that part<<<<and don't forget to don't forget. Cheers

I'm writing this review from the perspective of a person who gamed on Playstation his entire life, having barely played PC games and buying Half Life only because of the huge praise it got. After finishing the game, I have to say, this is one of best first person shooters I've ever played. 
Everything it does, is great; gameplay, level design, atmosphere, story, platforming and on. The first hour was boring for me, but I instantly fell in love with the clever level design of having to utilize vents and your trusty crowbar. From there on, it was a beautiful tale of Gordon Freeman and his tale of escapade from Black Mesa. 
This game did not need amazing CG cutscenes or an intricate storytelling narrative or overutilized/overly complex elements of the AAA games we get nowadays. All Half Life gave you was a tram to sit in that escorts you to work and as a very polite lady introduces you the science facility of Black Mesa, the safety guidelines of the workplace and a crowbar.
The thing that I find impressive the most is how this game was able to set itself apart, take a more slow, strategic and tactical approach to the FPS genre compared to Arena shooters at the time. With that said I can say, I have never played a game like this. 
The atmosphere is dripping with story, asking the character: "What happened here?". From the moment I pressed an elevator button and that action alone had consequences, I was hooked. There are gray areas, different characters have their own agendas, and by the end you might be asking yourself: "So..who was in the wrong?"
This is a must buy game.
One of the best fps games ever made or maybe it is the best. It won 50 awards for a reason.
Took me about 22 hours to finish the game on hard. Amazing game despite the age. Only real problem with the game was that there was no subtitles.

Il serait dommage de ne pas (au moins) essayer ce jeu, surtout qu'il atteint fréquemment un prix ridicule grâce aux soldes. Half-Life est un tournant dans l'histoire du jeu vidéo, et s'il est déjà vieux, son scénario et ses graphismes sont de réelles innovations pour son époque, il est donc bien plus qu'un doom-like basique. Après tout, c'est le premier succès d'une longue série dans l'histoire de Valve.

Concernant le scénario, il est vrai que l'idée générale peut sembler ordinaire (invasion de créatures venues d'un monde parallèle). Cependant, l'aventure présente quelques rebondissements intéressants. De plus, on en rate une bonne partie si on reste dans la peau de Gordon Freeman. Les extensions du jeu Opposing Force et Blue Shift (voire Decay), et surtout les informations complémentaires disponibles sur internet, permettent d'en savoir un peu plus sur l'incident de Black Mesa (qui reste assez flou pour le joueur). Si vous aimé Half-Life 2 (ou 3 s'il est sorti à l'heure où vous lisez, car il sortira, j'en suis persuadé, avant l'extinction de l'humanité), c'est votre devoir de fan d'approfondir et de jouer à l'original ! De même pour les joueurs de Portal, tout cela se déroule dans le même univers. Cependant, sachez que ce n'est absolument pas la même ambiance qui règne à Aperture et à Black Mesa.

En effet, ce jeu n'est pas vraiment humoristique (enfin on peut toujours le prendre à la légère et s'amuser à massacrer de pauvres innocents, mais ce n'est pas une conduite honnête). Il est plutôt glauque et oppressant, et en cela surpasse largement HL2. Gordon reste dans l'enceinte de Black Mesa, centre de recherche en grande partie souterrain, cherche à s'en échapper malgré ses dimensions pharamineuses, ce qui donne une impression d'enfermement. Le joueur se sent également très seul, les alliés qu'il a sont rares, faibles et malheureusement stupides. Le silence est parfois brisé par la téléportation fracassante d'un ennemi dans votre dos. Il y a quand même quelques musiques, entre autres pour rythmer les scènes d'action importantes.

Au niveau de l'expérience de jeu, dans les grandes lignes, c'est un FPS avec des armes variées et équilibrées allant du pied-de-biche au lance-roquettes à guidage laser ; il y a également une barre de vie et une barre d'énergie pour l'armure (tenant le rôle de bouclier). C'est donc un gameplay similaire à celui de Counter-Strike (à l'origine un des nombreux mods de Half-Life). Le jeu n'est pas trop difficile (il y a bien quelques passages un peu chauds, notamment sur les plate-formes, mais on peut toujours y aller à coup de sauvegarde, non ?). Il est d'ailleurs possible de changer de niveau de difficulté en cours de route (par contre désactivez vite l'aide à la visée si vous jouez en mode facile, à la souris en tout cas, c'est peut-être utile pour les manettes ?). Il ne s'agit pas toujours d'action, il y a pas mal d'énigmes. Le tout est accompagné de séquences de jeu assez originales que vous découvrirez vous-même.

Quant aux graphismes, ils datent mais ne sont pas désagréables. Ils participent peut-être même à l'ambiance malsaine du jeu. Si vraiment vous êtes allergiques aux vieux graphismes, tout n'est pas perdu, car un remake du jeu fait par des fans, Black Mesa, est déjà disponible. À l'heure actuelle, il est en accès anticipé et donc incomplet, il manque les derniers chapitres. Sinon, il reste Half-Life: Source, avec les améliorations (IA et physique) du moteur éponyme, mais les graphismes ne sont pas terribles non plus.

Finalement : achetez Half-Life, c'est le meilleur de la série. Ne vous privez pas d'acheter le reste pour autant.

J'ai terminé le jeu en 9h. C'étais quand meme bien. J'avou avoir passé plus de la moitié du jeu a attendre la fin pour passer au 2. De maniere général, le jeu est vraiment bon, surtout pour son age, et le sénario est vraiment bien. La fin est tres bonne, et j'ai la chance de ne pas avoir a attendre le prochain ahah.

C'étais une expériance agréable, j'ai pas pas mal de pauses, par contre. En 9h, j'ai dut faire environ 8 sessions, voir 7 ou 6 a la limite. J'ai pas vraiment compté. J'arretais sois par lacitude aux débuts de chapitre, ou biens car j'étais bloqué. Quand j'y retournais le jour d'apres, je me débloquais toujours. Il y a beaucoup de phases ou je me déplacais a 5 PV, donc j'abusais BEAUCOUP du F6 (Sauvegarde Rapide). C'étais parfois VRAIMENT difficile, meme en Normal. J'aurais limite mis Facile, avoir sus ! Ahah. Mais le jeu en sois est vraiment bon, et en achetant le Pack de Half life en rabais a 8$, je trouve que c'est vraiment abordable. La je vais essayer le 2, et toute les prochains voir si ca reste a la hauteur. Je pense bien que oui ;)

Half-Life é um ótimo jogo, marcante pela sua história que é narrada continuamente sem cutscenes, você nunca "perde o controle" do personagem. O enredo é muito interessante, estilo ficção científica com referências à cultura pop, como o Alien, e referências à física, como o próprio título do jogo. A música toca raramente, mas aparece nos momentos certos. O gameplay é fluido e frenético em alguns momentos. Enfim, graças a isso e muito mais, Half-Life entrou para a história dos games.

Wow. Davvero WOW. Ne ho sempre sentito parlare e basta ma non me ne sono mai interessato più di tanto. Non sono mai stato un amante del genere FPS. Poi mi è capitato tra le offerte e ho deciso di dargli un'opportunità. D'altronde stava a poco meno di due euro, un paio di caffé. Lasciatevelo dire, per essere un gioco dell'ormai lontano 1998 mi ha preso anche più del dovuto. Questo genere di giochi sono la prova provata che della grafica non te ne fai un c@xxo se c'è un ottimo gameplay dietro. E perché no, anche una bella e interessante storia (poi vabè, a me piace particolarmente il genere quindi sono di parte). E vorrei dire una cosa a chi afferma che è invecchiato male: NO. Assolutamente. Se così fosse non sarebbe sulla bocca di tutti. Mi è sembrato una bomba a me, oggi, anno 2016, figurarsi all'epoca che razza di mostro fosse. MI ha preso talmente tanto che ho recuperato persino i capitoli successivi e ora, dannazione, mi chiedo dove sia il terzo della serie. Fatevi un favore: compratelo, giocatelo e divertitevi!

I'm a new age FPS gamer. I pleasantly mowed down waves of infantry in Call of Duty before trying this game, so this review entirely lacks the nastalgia you might be reading in other reviews. I tried this on the notion that Half-Life was one of the innovators to the FPS genre. So, I waited for the bundle to go on sale and I bought the Half-Life Complete pack, cheaper to buy all the games than just one on the average day (thanks Valve). 

[h1] Graphics [/h1] 5/10
Have not aged well. But that is to be expected being released in 1998. And by no means is graphic fidelity a crucial defintion of a game's success.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1] 9/10
Surprisingly, I enjoyed the elements Valve introduced in Half-Life. I think after almost 2 decades, Half-Life still plays well and is comfortable to even the newer FPS players on PC like myself. There are some minor annoyances like the sliding movement, but you quickly adapt. 

[h1] Story [/h1] 6/10
I think this element is something Half-Life lacks, Gordon Freeman is the silent hero, we don't really learn much from this game. But like most franchises, the first release is merely an introduction. I think if you look at this game more as the prequel to the story introduced in Half-Life 2, then it can be a much more enjoyable experience. 

[h1] Conclusion [/h1]
Overall, I feel this game still holds up to gameplay standards. And gameplay alone is why I would truly recommend this game. It is a pleasant game to play. If you're looking for a challenge and haven't played Half-Life, give this a go. There's no quest markers, no one to hold your hand, and some points you feel the entire game has turned against you. But it's all in good fun. It's especially cheap during sales, and should run on even the most modest PCs.
Half-Life is quite an interesting game indeed. Fun and never seems to age. If your looking for something too kill time with and amazing story. Look no further.
